Assemble song lyric fragments from the words. The songs don't have much in common; the title is a very oblique hint about what aspect of the songs are relevant.
There's a sense in which the bracketed fragments of the lyric fragments have the same length.
Each bracketed fragment corresponds to five syllables.
Each bracketed fragment corresponds to five notes in the song.
Among the five notes in each bracketed fragment, there are two distinct pitches.
The pattern of pitches in each bracketed fragment corresponds to a letter via five-bit binary; the higher pitch is 1 and the lower pitch is 0.
